article.class: post-6266 post type-post status-publish format-standard category-bids-n-rfp category-news category-uncategorized entry override

h2.a: Solar Energy Power Purchase Agreement RFP Award

div.p: Under the Energy Savings Improvement Program (“ESIP”), the District issued an RFP (Request for Proposals) to solicit qualified companies to compete for a Solar Energy Power Purchase Agreement (RFP Number 2020-01) to generate solar electricity from solar energy systems to be located at the North Hunterdon and Voorhees High School locations. Click here for NHVRHSD […]

article.class: post-6263 post type-post status-publish format-standard category-news entry override

div.p: April 16, 2020 Dear Parents/Guardians and Students: Today Governor Murphy announced that all public schools in New Jersey will remain closed until at least Friday, May 15th, with another update to be provided next month. This means that we will continue virtual learning through May 15th and continue to follow our daily rotation schedule […]

article.class: post-6257 post type-post status-publish format-standard category-news entry override

div.p: The College Board has provided updates regarding the administration of AP exams this year. Exams will begin on May 11 and end on May 22. Make up exams will take place on June 1 through June 5. This year, students will take the exam at home or at school, if school is reopened. Exams will be […]

article.class: post-6254 post type-post status-publish format-standard category-news entry override

div.p: April 3, 2020 The North Hunterdon-Voorhees Regional High School District will indeed be closed for Spring Recess from Friday, April 10 through and including Friday, April 17. There will be no virtual learning taking place during Spring Recess. In addition, the faculty and staff have been informed that we are still having No Homework/No Pressure […]

article.class: post-6250 post type-post status-publish format-standard category-letters-parents category-news entry override

div.p: March 31, 2020 Dear Parents and Guardians: As we start the third week of virtual learning, I want to say again how proud I am of our teachers, staff members, administrators and students for their flexibility and commitment to the implementation of virtual learning. We understand this has not been an easy time for […]

article.class: post-6039 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail category-among-the-best entry override

h2.a: NH-V Among Best High Schools in America in U.S. News & World Report

div.p: North Hunterdon and Voorhees High Schools have ranked among the Best High Schools in America for 2019, according to U.S. … [Read More...]

article.class: post-9 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail category-among-the-best entry override

h2.a: NH-V Among Top High Schools in New Jersey Monthly

div.p: Both North Hunterdon and Voorhees High Schools are again among the Top High Schools in New Jersey, according to New Jersey … [Read More...]

article.class: post-7 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail category-among-the-best entry override

h2.a: NH-V Among Top High Schools in U.S. in Newsweek

div.p: Newsweek Magazine included the North Hunterdon-Voorhees District in its 2016 list of the top public high schools in the … [Read More...]

article.class: post-1085 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail category-among-the-best entry override

h2.a: NH-V Among Most Challenging High Schools in Washington Post List

div.p: The Washington Post has released its ranking of America's Most Challenging High Schools for 2016. Out of the 3,000 schools … [Read More...]

a.style: border: 1px solid #5b5b5b; color: #001a81; display: inline-block; padding: 8px 10px; text-shadow: none; border-radius: 10px; background-color: #ffffac;

div.div: (by signing up you will receive periodic email newsletters)

section.class: widget-odd widget-last widget-first widget-1 widget widget_wysiwyg_widgets_widget

span.strong:
North Hunterdon-Voorhees
Regional High School District

div.h6: WEBSITE ACCESSIBILITY: North Hunterdon-Voorhees Regional High School District is committed to making our content accessible to all members of the public, including those with disabilities. This includes parents, students, employees, and all others associated with our district. If you need assistance in accessing materials on the district website, please contact the webmaster at webmaster@nhvweb.net.

section.class: widget-odd widget-last widget-first widget-1 widget widget_wysiwyg_widgets_widget

p.span: The North Hunterdon-Voorhees Regional High School District, a district committed to innovation, personal excellence, high achievement, and community partnership, provides all students with personalized opportunities through a broad spectrum of exemplary educational experiences to develop their fullest potential, to foster lifelong learning, and to become responsible citizens in a continually changing society.

section.class: widget-odd widget-last widget-first widget-1 widget widget_wysiwyg_widgets_widget

div.strong: Dr. Richard Bergacs, District Anti-Bullying Coordinator
div.br:
Mailing Address: Same as District, Email: rbergacs@nhvweb.net, Phone: 908-735-2846 ext. 5103
Incident Report Forms – NHHS, VHS
Anonymous Reporting Form
Anti-Bullying Bill of Rights Act
NH-V District Policy 5512-Harassment, Intimidation and Bullying
Final Grade Report: 2015-2016, 2016-2017, 2017-2018
